alert.note: Alert for Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 19 at 1:48PM PDT until March 20 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM PDT MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch above 6000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM PDT Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range
